item.title: Deploying native apps to macOS
item.description: Level 0: warming up Deploying anything anywhere has never been easy business. Deploying applications to desktop computers is no different. OS X (now macOS) had its own solution of “dll hell”: each application should be absolutely self contained. All the dependencies and dependencies of dependencies should be distributed within the “bundle” so apps won’t conflict with other apps because of missing or outdated libraries. Sounds good in theory, but what does it mean in practice?
